course_title: Research Topics Seminar in Political Science: Citizen Politics
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course will be taught entirely online and will meet synchronously both days.


The role played by members of the general public in their country's politics is of fundamental importance for political science and, indeed, for the concept of democracy itself. Consequently, while bearing in mind the design and operation of political institutions and the motivations and actions of political elites, this course will focus on ordinary citizens' engagement in the democratic process.
course_description: Research Seminar on selected topics and problems in political science. Class will fulfill the "research" requirement for the political science major. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: POLS 208 or POLS_OX 208 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 3736, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: H. Tworzecki, Status: Open
